data.title: Not much here
data.text: Looking for just a bed? Here you are. Pretty basic. The room I had did not have a refrigerator or coffee maker. Oh, well. However, housekeeping did excellent job upon initial opening of room door. The room smelled clean, was tastefully decorated and the bathroom super clean. My room faced the highway and was not overly affected by the noise. This is a big, lots of rooms, Motel 6. The TV was small and the reception terrible. But, I was there for one night so what should I expect?

data.title: Only Choice
data.text: Staff person at check in was rude. Room was fair. One of the lights kept flickering and the TV had half the channels all fuzzy. Maids did not check in daily if towels were needed soaps were broke in half and they do not supply shampoo and conditioner. On the day of check out they were running a lawn mower at 7 am.

owner_response.author: 6Team, Brand Experienced Team Member at Motel 6 El Paso Central, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Karen,
            Thank you for sharing your concerns. Please know the service issues you describe are an exception to our guest commitment and as such, we apologize.  Our staff aims to provide the highest level of hospitality to our guests through our customer service, but with your experience we have fallen short and would like to apologize for the service issues you describe.   We invite you to contact our Guest Relations at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: You get what you pay for.
data.text:
Didn't expect a lot, but still disappointed. Hard bed, crappy sheets, entirely as expected for $50. 
However - the room was filthy. There was a grape on the floor in the bathroom. You'd flush the toilet but the tp (or grape, in this particular case) wouldn't go down the hole. Oh and the door took like 7 tries before it opened.

owner_response.author: 6Team, Brand Experience Team at Motel 6 El Paso Central, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Dear Meagan, Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We are committed to delivering a clean, comfortable room and apologize for any failure in delivering on the commitment during your recent stay. We strive to provide a comfortable night's rest and are disappointed your stay was unsatisfactory due to the comfort issues you describe. We invite you to contact our Guest Relations Department at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Clean, Good value, good location
data.text: Good location (close to downtown) and great price. Check in and check out was quick and friendly. The room and sheets were clean and the bed is comfortable. The TV was old but functional. The building looks old but because it is such an open design, you feel clean. The pool looks very nice but we did not use it. You may have to walk a few floors to find a functioning ice maker. There is I10 on one side and the train tracks on the other. However that did not bother us at all. No breakfast and you have to pay for WiFi which did not even work well. To us an affordable, clean and comfortable bed and bathroom is all we wanted and that worked.

data.title: Doesnt worth what you pay
data.text:
You go to this Motel 6 location knowing that you will stay in an old below standard hotel because you save up on the price. Wrong.
this price is expensive for what you receive, smelly rooms, not a single ice machine working, and you are in the middle of the summer.
this hotel is in very bad shape and they even charge you separately for wifi, and you need to be moving around catching the wifi signal which you paid.

ps. the front desk people acts like they are making you a favor, instead acting like they are getting paid for what they do.

thanks a lot Motel 6.

owner_response.author: 6Team, Brand Experience Team member at Motel 6 El Paso Central, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Mike,
         Thank you for sharing your feedback. We apologize for any misunderstanding that may have occurred during your recent stay with regard to our rate policies and the inconveniences you experienced. We are committed to delivering a clean, comfortable room and apologize for any failure in following through on that commitment during your recent stay.  We are glad to be able to provide Wi-Fi to our guests and apologize for the dissatisfaction you describe with our policy.  Our staff aims to provide the highest level of hospitality to our guests through our customer service, but with the experience you describe we have fallen short and would like to apologize for the service issues you experienced. We encourage you to contact our Guest Relations department at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very Close to The Train - and the noise
data.text: super Spartan. 13 inch TV Very,very close to the trains which seem to love to make noise. rooms are older, but decent. Shower tile from 1965 and a very odd color.  There are few hangers. The lights take time to figure out.

data.title: A Rest full stay
data.text: We got in late, and got a smoking room right away, the young lady at the front desk was very friendly.  then we went out to eat. We got back to the room and found it to be very clean, and it didn't smell like cigarette smoke, and it was  in good shape. Other than the noise from the road, and the shower head sprayed water all over the bathroom. We checked out the next morning and told the lady behind the desk about the shower and left. We had a rest full stay. We would stay again. Thank you sincerely D & L TRANSPORT.

data.title: Okey
data.text:
You get what you pay for. Clean and nice. Nice beds and easy access with the car. 
The trains that was passing by was pretty loud when they honk all the way through the city, but I guess I'm not the only one in that area that can hear it. 
If your not driving in the city you have to take a taxi. No walking distance.

data.title: One Night In El Paso
data.text: Older Motel 6 so sparce on the modern amenities.  Had trouble with first room's fire alarm beeping, so the desk kindly changed our rooms for us.  They put pet owners on bottom floor facing south because there is a small lawn area for pets to use.

data.title: Cheap and clean
data.text: You get what you pay for. It was clean and it was cheap. Service was friendly to all. Only issue I had was that there were trains that came by about every hour and honked their horn as they passed the intersection. Very loud and woke me up every time. The fan did down or the highway noise though but not the trains.

data.title: Ok for the price
data.text:
The price was only $39 a night. The location was centralized, so it doesn't take long to get to where you want.  The staff was very friendly also.

But besides the price though, this isn't a great place. No refrigerator, no clock, very thin walls with very poor sound insulation (you will hear things like the ice machine, trains, people talking..), old Tv, not-very-clean bathroom, and saw a couple cockroaches in there too. Wireless internet is also extra, but only $2.99 a day. However, the signal was so weak in my room (only one bar) that it was almost useless. Pool was closed.  

This motel is close to Ft Bliss and is probably a decent inexpensive getaway from the base on the weekends.

data.title: Good value economy lodging
data.text: Keeping in mind this is basic economy lodging, you get a basic, clean and comfortable room at a good value. This property is very old but was built as a Holiday Inn originally, therefore the room size is much larger than a typical Motel 6. I've stayed here several times and have always found the room to be clean and the front desk staff courteous & helpful. Also the guest laundry works well and the location, while in a mediocre neighborhood, is very convenient to all parts of the city. If you expect luxury you'll be disappointed, but if a basic clean room is what you need, this is it!

data.title: Will never stay at again!
data.text:
My boyfriend and I moved to El Paso and while we are looking for an apartment we've been staying in motels for the last few days. Our first night in town we stayed at this Motel 6 on the conditions that they had wi-fi and they said it wasn't a noisy place, that being important because we also have a 4 month old baby with us. So we check in and they give us our internet password to use for wi-fi just to find out when we get to our room that their internet was down and later found out that it had been when we check in to the room. The front desk clerk told us that they were going to have someone come and take a look and that it would be up no later than the next afternoon so we figured we could deal with that, but we needed the internet to look up apartments to look at. 
During the evening there were trains going by right behind the motel every 30 minutes making it very noisy. Our air conditionar also wasn't working properly and was rattling off and on during the night. 
In the morning we go to take showers to find hair and dirt all over the tub and hair and sludge in our sink. It was a very dirty and discusting place with dirt on our walls and light switches. There are also wild cats roaming the property that are quite vicious which made it very unsafe. We decided to check out that morning because of all of this and recieved no discount for the inconvienences. I have worked at a hotel for a few years and we always went above and beyond to make sure our guest felt welcome and recieved all the help they needed, but we did not get this type of service at this motel. The clerks weren't welcoming in anyway and did not help us out one bit.

data.title: No never again
data.text:
First off the door has a vent that you can open and close and mine didn't close second! The restroom vent was broken also. But that's ok things break. The deal breaker was the highway noise! Highway noise is tolerable when cars aren't hotrodding along the feeder road like they were all night at this location. But then there were also 3 guys standing outside my room all night with a dog. And peaple walked by every 3 minutes all night long. And there were kids outside till all hours.
It was miserable and I promise to never stay at another motel 6 again as long as places which could be repaired and watched are taken care of.stay away if you need sleep.

data.title: Great stay for the price
data.text: The rooms are large. The staff was friendly.  There was not internet in the rooms.  The carpet was stained but our rooms was cleaned each day. There is an Arbys right next door.

data.title: The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly
data.text: This motel really sucked. It was in a terrible location, there was a man screaming and yelling in the middle of the night, a train went by every ten minutes (even during the night), the beds were uncomfortable, the cleanliness was okay, but most of all we couldn't sleep and that is very important. We were just glad to leave.

data.title: Home Away from Home
data.text: I travel to El Paso frequently to get dental work done in Juarez.  I've never had a problem securing a room and this motel allows me to bring my cat along with me.  It's very easy to keep my room if I need to extend my stay longer than originally planned, which is common with dental work.  The rooms are comfortable and clean.  The staff has always been friendly and makes me feel at home.  I have checked other hotels in the area, and this is the ONLY hotel I will stay at because of their convenience, cost, and easy availability.  Thanks for all you have done during my stays and I look forward to my next visit this week.
